attributes.action: Why are so many disabled young people with EHCP being  let down by there  LA
attributes.additional_details:
The statistics for the 2014–15 academic year show that:

Pupils with identified special educational needs (SEN) accounted for just over half of all permanent exclusions and fixed-period exclusions.
Pupils with SEN support had the highest permanent exclusion rate and were more than seven times more likely to receive a permanent exclusion than pupils with no SEN.
Pupils with an education, health and care (EHC) plan or with a statement of SEN had the highest fixed-period exclusion

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We understand that you're concerned about the support available for young people with an EHCP, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
